definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Cyndi continued to play local clubs, but this time as a solo artist.
sentences.chinese: 她又繼續遊走於小型娛樂場所，這次卻是她一個人。

sentences.english: But the lethal creature bobbed off.
sentences.chinese: 好在這些致命生物又遊走了。

sentences.english: All the work of the Paris embroiderers was exquisite in its artistry and subtlety.
sentences.chinese: 所有的巴黎刺繡工在藝術和細微間是精緻遊走。

sentences.english: Consequently it became a symbol of the marginal and the semi-legal.
sentences.chinese: 因此它成爲遊走在邊緣的和半合法的象徵。

sentences.english: The fish cringed away from the bait when the wan with the fishing rod coughed.
sentences.chinese: 垂釣者咳嗽了一聲，魚兒便嚇得從釣鉺旁遊走了。

sentences.english: They are those things that are wandering around aimlessly in your head.
sentences.chinese: 它們是一些在你腦中漫無目的遊走的東西。

sentences.english: They then penetrate the wall of the intestine and migrate through the body.
sentences.chinese: 幼蟲隨後穿過腸壁，並在身體內遊走。

sentences.english: Place a fingertip on each side of your clitoris, sliding them up and down and back again.
sentences.chinese: 把指尖放於陰蒂的每一邊，上下並且往復滑動遊走。

sentences.english: All he could do was walk the earth a ghost, a lantern .
sentences.chinese: 他所能做的就是，提著燈籠，做鬼在人間遊走。

sentences.english: I am a soul which roves around in the heaven.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個遊走在天堂的靈魂。

sentences.english: A lonely man, holding the incomplete heart, wander in lost edge.
sentences.chinese: 一個人，孤單地捧着殘缺的心，遊走在迷惘的邊緣。

sentences.english: Robe-clad figures moved among the tents like specters.
sentences.chinese: 穿着長袍的人影如鬼怪般在帳間遊走。

sentences.english: Thursday's child has far to go;
sentences.chinese: 星期四出生的孩子將會遊走四方。

sentences.english: As they sailed away a pack of sea otters swam out and gnawed holes in their boats.
sentences.chinese: 當他們揚帆時，一羣海獺遊走並在船身上咬了一些洞。

definition: all over the place/everywhere and all directions
to loiter (i.e. reluctant to leave)/to linger on

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
to look for/to seek/to find fault
to flow/to circulate/to go from place to place/to be mobile/(of assets) liquid
